casebody.data:
Laurel Produce Growers Association, a corporation created by and existing under the laws of the State of Delaware, d. b. a., vs. Reese O. Gordy, p. b. r. (February 11, 1924.)

Harrington and Richards, J. J., sitting.

James M. Tumtell for plaintiff. John M. Richardson for defendant. Superior Court for Sussex County, February Term, 1924. No. 57, February term, 1923. *406Richards, J.

We think that the book in question has been sufficiently identified as being the account book of the defendant in its transactions with the plaintiff. We, therefore, think that it is admissible against the defendant on the ground that it is an admission against interest. 2 Ency. of Ev., pp. 664, 666; Currier v. Boston & M. R. Co., 31 N. H. 209; Allen v. Coitt, 6 Hill. (N. Y.) 318.
